text: Grant Albrecht (born January 29, 1981) is a Canadian luger who has competed since 1998. Competing in two Winter Olympics, he earned his best finish of tenth in the men's doubles event at Turin in 2006. Albrecht's best finish at the FIL World Luge Championships was ninth in the men's doubles event at Nagano in 2004. After his competition career Albrecht has worked as a luge coach, coaching the Australian national team at the 2010 Winter Olympics in Vancouver and subsequently coaching the Norwegian national team before being appointed as Alberta Development Coach by the Canadian Luge Association in August 2011. He resides in Red Deer, Alberta in the offseason. ==References== * 2002 luge men's doubles results (todor66.com) * 2006 luge men's doubles results (todor66.com) * CBC.ca profile * FIL-Luge profile == External links == * * * * Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian male lugers Category:Canadian sports coaches Category:Olympic lugers of Canada Category:Lugers at the 2002 Winter Olympics Category:Lugers at the 2006 Winter Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Red Deer, Alberta Category:Canadian people of German descent
title: Grant Albrecht
